item.description:
Campus freethought organizer Katie Van Adzin writes: "This is the kick-off screening in the F.O.R.U.S. film series, presented by Secular Wellesley, Wellesley College's atheist student group.
This screening is free and open to the public. It's a terrific film, hope you can make it! Send any questions to Katie: kvanadzi at wellesley dot edu."

CONSTANTINE'S SWORD is the story of James Carroll; a former Catholic priest on a journey to confront his past and uncover the roots of religiously inspired violence and war. His search also reveals a growing scandal involving religious infiltration of the U.S. military and the terrible consequences of religion’s influence on America’s foreign policy.

Trailer available at http://www.youtube.co...
Wednesday, Nov. 17th at 5:30 PM in Collins Cinema
item.name: Screening of Constantine's Sword at Wellesley
